Author: Allison
Title: Profile menu enhancements in global navigation
EnhancedContent:
Weâ€™ve made the profile menu in global navigation more specific to your actions so itâ€™s simpler and helps you get where you need to go faster. This update keeps the menu focused on the options that matter most for your workflow.

![Before-and-after view of GitHub’s profile dropdown menu showing a redesign](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ab3342a4-4c40-4a04-94b6-d425fe5bb219)

### ðŸš€ Whatâ€™s new

- The profile menu now puts relevant actions front and center, like viewing your profile, repositories, and enterprises.
- You can set your status and use [single sign-on (SSO)](https://github.blog/changelog/2025-08-07-single-sign-on-banners-consolidated-across-github/) directly from the top of the menu.
- Quick links for appearance and accessibility settings are now easier to find so you can personalize your experience.
- Weâ€™ve removed links that arenâ€™t tied to user actions so the menu is easier to scan and use.

### ðŸ’¬ How to provide feedback

We want to know what you think. Join the [community discussion](https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/172081) to share your thoughts or ask questions about the new profile menu.
